subclusters.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
Replicative Senescence and Tumor Suppression Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of senescent cells, their SASP secretion, and impact on tissue dysfunction and aging; includes senolytic interventions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes irreversible growth arrest, SASP, and dual roles of senescence in aging and pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of senescent cells, SASP-driven inflammaging, and protective/detrimental roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details accumulation of senescent cells in bone, SASP effects, and causal role in age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescent cell accumulation, SASP, apoptosis resistance, and senolytic targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cells in lymphoid organs, SASP, and contribution to immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as causal driver of aging and ARDs, SASP, and molecular pathways linking senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses accumulation of senescent cells, SASP, and therapeutic targeting in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details irreversible growth arrest, SASP, cGAS-STING inflammatory pathway, and metabolic reprogramming in senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers fundamental role of senescence, SASP, causal role in aging, and senolytic development.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence-driven aging, SASP secretion, and propagation of senescence signals.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence, SASP, and vascular/neuroinflammation driven by senescent cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains apoptosis resistance in senescent cells, SASP-driven inflammaging, and aging acceleration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Infection-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on microbial induction of senescence, SASP, barrier disruption, and systemic inflammation in aging and Alzheimer's disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroinflammation-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in multiple brain cell types, SASP-driven neuroinflammation, and Parkinson's disease pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Postmitotic Cellular Senescence (PoMiCS) Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence in non-dividing postmitotic cells, SASP, and dual roles in tissue health and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Programmed and Apoptosis-Linked Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers cellular senescence and programmed cell death as fundamental aging mechanisms with evolutionary conservation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Developmentally Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cellular senescence as a programmed developmental process with distinct molecular regulation and evolutionary conservation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Developmentally Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on embryonic senescence, distinct molecular pathways from stress-induced senescence, and dual roles in development and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: INK4a/Arf Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details senescence induction via INK4a/Arf locus, tumor suppressor pathways, species differences, and evolutionary plasticity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: INK4a/Arf Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Arf/p53 pathway as damage sensor protecting against aging and cancer, linking senescence to damage control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Tumor Suppression Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on finite proliferative capacity, genetic control of senescence, and tumor suppression via growth regulatory pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Tumor Suppression Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes replicative senescence, stem cell exhaustion, organ mass loss, and evolutionary trade-off between cancer suppression and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Tumor Suppression Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomere shortening as cause of replicative senescence and its correlation with aging and cancer resistance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitotic Checkpoint Deficiency-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes BubR1 deficiency causing mitotic checkpoint failure, aneuploidy, and early senescence contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Senescence-Induced Structural Variation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence-induced epigenetic changes, transposable element derepression, mitochondrial DNA integration, and somatic genomic variation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy and Proteostasis-Linked Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes noncanonical ATG8-ABS3 interaction regulating senescence via proteostasis and autophagy-related pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy and Proteostasis-Linked Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in autophagy, tissue-specific regulation, and autophagy as causal mechanism for longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes chronic stress leading to premature senescence, metabolic decline, and thermodynamic framework of aging.
